meanings.definition: The quality or state of being prefigurative.
meanings.sent1: Her prefigurativenesses in predicting the future events amazed everyone.
meanings.sent2: The prefigurativenesses of the dream hinted at what was to come.
meanings.sent3: The prefigurativenesses of his fortune-telling skills made him the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: The old painting seemed to possess a prefigurativenesses of the war to come.
meanings.sent5: The eerie prefigurativenesses of the ancient prophecy sent shivers down their spines.

meanings.definition: The act of prefiguring or foreshadowing something.
meanings.sent1: The prefigurativenesses of the oracle's words left them in awe.
meanings.sent2: His prefigurativenesses in predicting the outcome of the game were uncanny.
meanings.sent3: The prefigurativenesses of the weather forecast made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds were a prefigurativenesses of the storm approaching.
meanings.sent5: The sudden silence in the room was a prefigurativenesses of the impending announcement.
